intro: Diplospora kurzii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved diplospora, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and other related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a distinctive narrow shape. Diplospora kurzii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
